On 28 September 2012 09:46, Ruben Verborgh <ruben.verborgh@...> wrote:=


>
> If there=92s no stability, how can a REST system possibly work?
> Oka=
y, right, hypermedia=85 (assuming that at least the starting URI remains
> =
stable)
> but we can't expect clients to navigate to the desired resource e=
very time
> again, can we?
>
> In theory, yes, in in practice, no.  A serve=
r is likely to make some
additional URIs bookmarkable along the client's jo=
urney through its
hypermedia; staging posts, if you will.

I like the idea =
that came up on a thread here recently (new to me if not
anyone else) that =
the "bookmark" rel is used to indicate this.

--bcaec54fb3e488d86804cabf3834
